course.title: Econometrics I
course.description: (1) Review of probability theory, (2) causality and identification, (3) statistical decision theory, and (4) asymptotic frequentist inference. Empirical applications from labor economics, economics of education, and public finance. Some assignments using Matlab.
course.prerequisites: Probability (Stat 110), Linear Algebra and Calculus (Math 21a and 21b), and Real Analysis (Math 112).
course.notes: Enrollment limited to PhD candidates in economics, business economics, health policy, public policy, and political economy and government (PEG).
